alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued July 16 at 9:45PM EDT until July 17 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Little to no inundation above ground level will occur along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.9 to 7.0 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Charleston and Coastal Colleton Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 11:31 PM today at Charleston. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/12 AM 7.0 1.2 0.7 N/A Minor 17/12 PM 6.0 0.2 0.5 N/A None 18/01 AM 6.5 0.7 0.5 N/A None 18/01 PM 5.7 -0.1 0.2 N/A None 19/01 AM 6.0 0.2 0.3 N/A None 19/02 PM 5.6 -0.2 0.1 N/A None &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
